review.title: “Reasearch assistant”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent work environment; great interaction with student, professors and researchers; great campus with sport center on site; Salary is fair particularly compared to other European countries
review.cons: Cons – No complaint, except maybe the quality of the cantine, but then again the slection is really large.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work, which helps attract talents from all over the world

review.title: “PhD student in Electrical Engineering”
review.pros: Pros – - I worked as a PhD student in TU/e for 4 years. The research (e.g. cleanroom) facilities were excellent, as well as the scientific level of my supervisors/colleagues. Low pressure, agreeable work environment. Very good courses for personal development.- Net salary: 1500 / 1800 eur (1st / 4th year) + Holiday allowance.- Holidays: 40 days/year.
review.cons: Cons – - A bit too much freedom. You have to push yourself sometimes to make sure your project is progressing.- Dutch weather/food.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Student-assistant”
review.pros: Pros – Very open culture. Everybody is willing to help you.
review.cons: Cons – I would like to see this university a bit more ambitious. To my opinion it is the best university of The Netherlands, and for some research areas they are competing with the best universities in the world. People do not always seem to be aware of this. Or at least, they do not communicate this.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Very good place to start your scientific career”
review.pros: Pros – Nice environment to work during master or PhD
review.cons: Cons – Difficult career opportunities after postdoc
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A good learning and research environment.”
review.pros: Pros – Well organized, good support of PhD students.
review.cons: Cons – Working in isolation is common for PhD students.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Create better access to the researchers for the industry. Less red tape for shorter projects.

review.title: “Very nice and straightforward employer”

review.cons: Cons – EindhovenUniversity politicsLunchStuck to School holidays

review.title: “A pleasure place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Multidisciplinary teams, rich in culture, work with young and lead researchers.
review.cons: Cons – Old offices and buildings, service is not good enough in the city
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “It is a nice place to do PhD research.”
review.pros: Pros – High level of academic research, not much external pressure, good technical support, opportunities for international conferences, reasonable salary for a PhD student
review.cons: Cons – The quantity and quality of local bachelor students are declining, an unfavorable situation for maintaining the education system and high level research.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Dig into the student pool to get better students for the bachelor program as a technical university. Encourage interest from mid-school students on science and engineering.

review.title: “Perfect place to do research”
review.pros: Pros – Good education, healthy working environment, a lot of practical tools
review.cons: Cons – very difficult to stay after PhD or Postdoc or to get a permanent position
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “where the innovation starts”
review.pros: Pros – Tu/e has very good connections with many industry companies, like Philips, NXP, AMSL, etc. Many projects are cooperated with industry partners.
review.cons: Cons – Dutch language will be a difficulty to the foreigners, although the working language in research is English. The classes for undergraduates are conducted in Dutch.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It is a very good place to carry out research work, but it will be better to further improve the cooperation between the groups.

review.title: “Worth the effort”

review.cons: Cons – Low SalaryProjects might be in other cities and you have to move
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend
